title: German Navy, Eyes on China, Adds to Europe’s Pacific Presence
sub_head: The frigate Bayern, visiting Tokyo, plans to work with Japan, U.S. and other allies
body:
TOKYO—The German navy’s flagship will join exercises with the U.S. and its allies in the western Pacific, a modest but symbolic broadening of an alliance of democracies countering China’s growing maritime power.
The Bayern, a frigate that recently visited Australia and Guam, docked in Tokyo on Friday. The ship held exercises with the Japanese navy this week and will join the U.S., Canadian, Australian and Japanese navies to build interoperability skills from Nov. 20 to 30, according to German officials.
